meanings.definition: To regard or treat with disfavor.
meanings.sent1: She was disfavoring the new policy due to its impact on employees.
meanings.sent2: The manager was disfavoring the idea of extending work hours.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be disfavoring the new brand of cat food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism was disfavoring her confidence, like a dark cloud over her head.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's disfavoring of late assignments was well-known among the students.

meanings.definition: Showing disapproval or dislike towards something or someone.
meanings.sent1: Her disfavoring expression made it clear she was not pleased with the situation.
meanings.sent2: The disfavoring look on his face indicated his lack of interest in the topic.
meanings.sent3: The disfavoring cat refused to play with the new toy, showing its picky nature.
meanings.sent4: The disfavoring clouds in the sky seemed to mirror his gloomy mood.
meanings.sent5: The disfavoring tone in her voice hinted at her dissatisfaction with the decision.
